text:
Hey Jorge, this is great btw! I love all the info and questions. I'll focus on the important bit!
I like your reel, has an interesting style and diverse in the different shots! Yeah about the magazine shots, its always a lot to take in a new program and all the complications that come with making something, its tricky, but it's great you managed to pull it off.
Regarding your interest in the music video, they have a "making of" that might help, a friend showed me this a couple years back and its impressive work, its a lot of everything, animation, modeling, vfx, simulation.
<https://youtu.be/ifAE5MWR-4k>

And about your interests.
1 - I think there definitely is a way to animate as fluid as 2D, it will depend a lot on the rig, but also the style your going for. Let me send you a few clips and you let me know if this makes sense.
<https://vimeo.com/user1433739>
<https://vimeo.com/344916654>
<https://vimeo.com/280360309>
<https://youtu.be/M1lzJuwJD9k?t=123>

Just a few that comes to mind, also looking at what "Into the Spiderverse" made and the work by Alberto Mielgo is pretty impressive!
So it would depend on the style your going for but there's definitely a way!

2. I'd start off, by finding reference of 2D work that inspires and you'd like to translate into 3D, study the timing, is it on 2's or 1's? or a combination? Is it pose heavy or timing heavy? Things like that.
And once you have an idea, I'd try mimicking a specific shot in 3D matching the exact timing and trying to get the same poses, it will tell you so much about how it works.

You said your interested in experimenting with 3D and reality, but also on getting a 2D feel to 3D animation? Are you thinking of combining those 2 ideas somehow?

text: Don't feel the need to answer, but do you have any longer term goals? A place you'd like to work at? Or if you'd like to make your own movies and such?
